Ali.Action: Takes responsibility for the child Sam by leaving with him and trying to figure out their next steps after a conflict.
Speaks to Sam firmly with 'Move it!' after hanging up on the phone.
Takes leftover water and food to share with Sam when they have no money.
Firmly asks Sam to stop banging his feet against the seat, showing patience but setting boundaries.
Supports Sam physically by carrying him on his shoulder when Sam is tired.
Notices the half-empty bottle of water and takes it; searches through garbage for more supplies; shares food and water with Sam.
Commands Sam to stop banging his feet and successfully makes him comply.
Carries Sam when he is tired and extenuated, while also managing their belongings and making phone calls to get picked up.
Mentions they have no money in response to Sam's thirst, but quickly finds a solution by scavenging water and food.
Carries Sam piggyback down the road.
Admits to not knowing if his son Sam is in school, shows some distance from the child's routine but engages in conversation about it.
Clarifies that the passport was already in the Spiderman bag and does not defend or make excuses for the mother, showing a straightforward and somewhat blunt attitude.
Responds to his sister Anna's concern about caring for the child with a somewhat resigned tone, indicating he is in a difficult situation but still present.
Admits he can't pay rent because he had to pay for the train, expresses uncertainty about how to manage financially.
Responds to Anna's firm tone about paying rent or leaving with a question showing vulnerability: 'What should I have done with the kid? Where should I have gone?'
Avoids confrontation by giving short answers but does not argue or cause conflict.
Admits not having money to pay rent and shows uncertainty about how to solve financial problems, responding vaguely about finding a job.
Communicates openly about his financial struggles and situation to Anna, showing some honesty and directness.
Keeps his cool when grabbed by the security guard and responds with humor and confidence rather than anger.
Fights the security guard, then celebrates his victory with a playful moonwalk and kisses his own biceps.
Reassures Sam when he is upset and stays with him, unlocking the moped to help him.
Engages warmly with Sam during their time at the beach, asking about what he likes and playing with him.
Looks at girls in swimsuits while with Sam, momentarily distracted.
Reassures Sam not to cry and unlocks the moped for him, demonstrating care and responsibility.
Sells a camera for a small amount of money in a street alley, indicating some practical skill in making quick transactions.
Distracted by watching girls in swimsuits rather than focusing on assembling the toy with his son, showing lack of attention at the moment.

Describes trainer's death without bitterness, implying acceptance.

Maintains a calm and confident demeanor while being questioned, indicating self-assurance.
Shows awareness of physical condition and healthy habits by denying smoking and drinking when asked.

Helps a girl who has been punched in the face by assisting her to stand and breathe properly.
Insists on calling a cab for the injured girl, showing concern for her safety.
Delivers a few punches effectively, lifts one guy off his feet, grabs another by the collar during the fight.
Helps the injured woman (Stephanie) by instructing her to breathe and walk, showing some knowledge and concern.
Insists she cannot drive in her condition and offers to call a cab, acting responsibly and confidently.
Punches are described as 'random,' which may imply lack of refined skill or strategy in fighting.
Offers to help Stephanie with her injured wrist and tries to make her comfortable by adjusting her seat despite his own pain.
Questions Stephanie about why she goes to the Fever alone and makes intrusive, judgmental comments about her appearance, calling her a hooker.
Ignores Stephanie's request to stop the car after she gets upset by his remarks.
Manipulates the car seat knob to increase Stephanie's comfort despite his own pain.

Fails to respond when Stephanie orders him to stop the car, showing omission or avoidance of direct conflict.
No reaction when Stephanie demands to stop the car, showing indifference to her urgency.
Suggests staying at Stephanie's place and seeks ice for his injured wrist, showing a degree of openness and practical trust.
Brusque response to Stephanie's refusal to let him come up immediately.

Leaves Simon and Stephanie his number in case they need him, then departs.

Crying and telling Sam not to go into the disgusting shower area, showing emotional response but taking protective action.
